metadata.title: CVE-2021-39263 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A crafted NTFS image can trigger a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by anunsanitized attribute in ntfs_get_attribute_value, in NTFS-3G < 2021.8.22.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39263` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libntfs-3g883 - 1:2017.3.23AR.3-3ubuntu5
ntfs-3g - 1:2017.3.23AR.3-3ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntfs-3g package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2017.3.23AR.3-3ubuntu5').
